most_active_tickets.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all

Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Startup Failure
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS failing to launch or getting stuck during startup, particularly after updates. The issue affected macOS and Windows, often manifesting as frozen "core dependencies" loading. Solutions included patches addressing data migration, conflicting software, and installer issues.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* **Issue:** PiecesOS startup problems on multiple platforms (Windows and macOS) after migration to new stack.
* **Symptoms:** App stuck on dependencies step, systray icon missing, crashes, PFD connection issues.
* **Identified Problems:**
    * Migration issues with large user data.
    * Self-signed certificate issues.
    * Conflicting software (Onedrive).
    * App installer issues.
    * Bug in macOS PFD app.
* **Solutions Implemented:**
    * Major migration of data resolved.
    * AppInstaller build provided.
    * Windows user logs requested.
    * macOS PFD app re-opening suggested.
    * Patch for conflicting software released.
    * macOS PFD app bug fix in v3.3.8.

**Current Status:**

* Most issues resolved, with ongoing work on macOS PFD app stability.

**Outcome:**

* The majority of users are now able to run PiecesOS successfully.

## Additional Notes:

* Not all user issues were directly addressed in the conversation.
* The conversation demonstrates the importance of clear communication and collaboration between developers and users.
* The team's commitment to resolving issues and improving the user experience is evident.

## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* User experiencing issues with launching Pieces Desktop Version on Windows.
* The problem appears to be related to hardware requirements being stricter than anticipated with version 11.1.1.

**Identified Problems:**

* User unable to launch PiecesOS.
* Logs requested from user to investigate the cause of the problem.

**Proposed and Implemented Solutions:**

* Patch released for version 11.1.2 to address issues identified in 11.1.1.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue has been resolved with the release of version 11.1.2.
* User encouraged to update PiecesOS and confirm resolution of the problem.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch failure due to AVX2 incompatibility
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported PiecesOS crashing or failing to launch after upgrading to version 11.1.1. The issue stemmed from a new dependency requiring AVX2 instruction set support, which some older CPUs lack. The Pieces team addressed this by releasing a patched version 11.1.2 with a workaround, resolving the launch issue for affected users.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After upgrade PiecesOS to version 11.1..1 it crashes every time immediately after launch. Previous version worked well. Attached is the crash report log.

Environment: 

- OS MacOS 15.2
- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User `gonzososa` reported an issue where PiecesOS was unable to launch.
* Pieces support team acknowledged the issue and identified that it was caused by a new vector library that had some AVX2 compatibility issues.
* Support team requested information about the user's CPU.
* User provided information about their CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-3210M CPU @ 2.50GHz.
* User `hra42` identified the root cause of the issue as AVX2 support requirement.
* Pieces team released a fix in version 11.1.2. 

**Problems Identified:**

* New vector library had AVX2 compatibility issues.
* PiecesOS was unable to launch on some systems due to AVX2 requirement.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces team released a new version (11.1.2) with a fix for the AVX2 compatibility issues.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is fixed in version 11.1.2.
* User `gonzososa` confirmed that the issue was resolved with the fix.

**Additional Notes:**

* This issue affected users with CPUs that did not support AVX2.
* The issue was identified and resolved quickly by the Pieces support team.

## Conclusion

This GitHub issue conversation demonstrates how the Pieces support team effectively identified and resolved an issue reported by a user. The team provided clear communication and updates throughout the process, ensuring the user was informed and able to access a fix promptly.

related_issues.title: Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
related_issues.text:
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## GitHub Issue Summary: Unable to Boot PiecesOS (620)

### Key Points:

* User @GetReal444 reported experiencing an error when booting PiecesOS.
* Error was traced to missing hardware support for AVX2.
* Initial assumption was isolated hardware issue, later determined to be widespread.
* Pieces team acknowledged and actively worked on a solution.

### Problems Identified:

* AVX2 hardware requirement in the database service prevented booting for some users.
* Lack of clarity about new hardware requirement.

### Solutions Proposed/Implemented:

* Pieces team investigated potential hardware solutions and patches.
* A new release (version 11.1.2) containing a fix was deployed.

### Current Status/Outcome:

* User confirmed successful boot after updating to version 11.1.2.
* Issue appears resolved for affected users.

### Additional Notes:

* Pieces team proactively communicated updates and estimated timeframes for resolution.
* Issue highlights importance of clear communication about hardware requirements for users.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS fails to launch due to database error
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported PiecesOS failing to launch on Ubuntu and Windows, encountering a "DatabaseException" or a blank error screen. The issue was linked to missing AVX2 hardware support and stricter hardware requirements in version 11.1.1. The Pieces team released version 11.1.2 to address this problem, urging users to update to the latest version.

related_issues.title: Facing error on Ubuntu while opening Pieces "DatabaseException"
related_issues.text:
Facing error on Ubuntu while opening Pieces "DatabaseException"
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Faccing "DatabaseException(Unable to load 'CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch' extenstion" (1), code : can'tOpenFile)" on my ubuntu desktop 
## Issue Summary: Pieces App Application Not Booting Up

**Key points:**

* User (@Rohit0072) reported an issue with Pieces app not booting up.
* Pieces support team identified and categorized the issue.
* Related issues (#602, #456, #618) and resources were provided for user review.

**Problems identified:**

* Pieces app fails to boot up.

**Solutions implemented:**

* Pieces team investigated the issue and related its potential cause to other reported issues (#620, #624, and #625).
* A new version of PiecesOS (11.1.2) was released to address the issue.
* Users were instructed to update to the latest version.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Issue was not confirmed as resolved by initial user. No additional updates or user responses observed. 
* Issue resolution remains uncertain till confirmation (open/closed status remains valid upon initial report till user reopens, if necessary).
* Pieces team requested the user to re-open the issue if the problem persisted after updating to the latest version.

**Additional Notes:**

* User (@tsavo-at-pieces) pointed out the similarity to multiple other reported issues 
* Issue related to PiecesOS version - requiring update for fixes to take effect. 
* Users encouraged to contact Pieces support team (mark-at-pieces) directly for quicker response - contact details provided within the conversation.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Launching Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS failing to launch on macOS and Windows after updating to version 11.1.0 or 11.1.1. The issues involved slow boot-up or complete failure to launch. A potential solution was identified as accidentally installing the Intel version on ARM Macs. The Pieces team released version 11.1.2 to address these issues, urging users to update and confirm resolution.

related_issues.title: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0
related_issues.text: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0 If you cannot open PiecesOS after updating to 11.1.0 and you are on an arm Machine M1, M2, M3,...etc then it is likely that you accidentally installed the intel version of the application. If you are Unsure. Please uninstall Pieces OS from your applications folder and reinstall from https://docs.pieces.app/installation-getting-started/macos (Arm == Apple Silicon) You can tell if you are working with Arm architecture if you see something that resembles this within your 'About this Mac' If you are still having issues after trying these steps please feel free to add a comment on this issue and schedule a time on my calendar here. https://calendar.app.google/MGd9i5gELtiDjWZm8 ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation **Key Points Raised:** * The issue is resolved. **Problems Identified:** * None explicitly mentioned. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * The issue was resolved. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The issue is closed. **Additional Notes:** * The conversation only contains one comment stating the issue is resolved. Without further context, it's impossible to determine the specific details of the issue or the steps taken to resolve it.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Boot-up and Download Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported issues with PiecesOS, including slow boot-up times and failures to download local LLMs. These issues seem to stem from problems with specific PiecesOS versions and potential hardware compatibility issues. The Pieces team has released updates (versions 11.1.2 and later) to address these problems. Users experiencing these issues are recommended to update to the latest version and check for compatibility.

related_issues.title: Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
related_issues.text:
Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
Error: HttpException: Connection closed before full header was received, uri = http://127.0.0.1:39300/model/2fca5f65-b3ce-459b-b394-0ea5de0b050d/download/progress

**Installation Details**

Succeeded: true
Path: C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\com.MeshIntelligentTechnologi.PiecesOS_11.0.4.0_x64__84gz00a5z79wr/os_server.exe

**PiecesOS Information**

ID: 62ded9e8-d9d0-490e-b34e-632516b3cf1a

User: Anonymous
Current Version: 11.0.4
Min Version Supported: 11.0.4
Max Version Supported: 12.0.0
Local Port: 39300

**Device Information**

Operating System: Windows
Current Version: "Windows 10 Home Single Language" 10.0 (Build 26100)
Min Version Supported: Windows 10 Build 1903
## GitHub Issue Summary: Unable to download local LLM

**Key Points:**

* User reported an issue where they were unable to open the Pieces Copilot service.
* The issue appears to be related to downloading local large language models (LLMs).
* User received support resources from the bot and was contacted by @mark-at-pieces for further information.

**Problems Identified:**

* An exception is encountered during the download of local LLMs. 
* The specific error message is: "Connection closed before full header was received, uri = http://127.0.0.1:39300/model/2fca5f65-b3ce-459b-b394-0ea5de0b050d/download/progress"
* It's unclear whether the issue is consistent or occurs only occasionally.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mark-at-pieces requested the user to provide the support logs for Pieces OS.
* The user was asked to confirm whether they were able to download any local LLM or if the error occurred every time.
* A potential fix for this issue may have been implemented in Pieces version 11.1.2.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Unclear if the user responded with the requested information or confirmed the resolution of the issue.
* @mark-at-pieces requested the user to reopen the issue if the problem persisted after the potential fix.

**Further Notes:**

* This summary only includes information from the provided conversation. 
* Additional information may be available within the GitHub issue itself or through further communication between the user and support personnel.

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## GitHub Issue Summary: Unable to Boot PiecesOS (620)

### Key Points:

* User @GetReal444 reported experiencing an error when booting PiecesOS.
* Error was traced to missing hardware support for AVX2.
* Initial assumption was isolated hardware issue, later determined to be widespread.
* Pieces team acknowledged and actively worked on a solution.

### Problems Identified:

* AVX2 hardware requirement in the database service prevented booting for some users.
* Lack of clarity about new hardware requirement.

### Solutions Proposed/Implemented:

* Pieces team investigated potential hardware solutions and patches.
* A new release (version 11.1.2) containing a fix was deployed.

### Current Status/Outcome:

* User confirmed successful boot after updating to version 11.1.2.
* Issue appears resolved for affected users.

### Additional Notes:

* Pieces team proactively communicated updates and estimated timeframes for resolution.
* Issue highlights importance of clear communication about hardware requirements for users.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of PiecesOS launch failures:** The majority of reported issues relate to PiecesOS failing to launch, particularly after updates. Focus on addressing root causes such as data migration issues, conflicting software, and installer problems.

**Improve communication about hardware requirements:** Several users encountered issues due to stricter hardware requirements, specifically AVX2 support. Clearly communicate these requirements on the download page, installation instructions, and release notes.

**Investigate and address slow boot-up times:** Multiple users reported slow boot-up times, impacting their workflow. Investigate the root cause and explore optimization strategies to improve startup performance.

**Enhance error messaging and troubleshooting documentation:** Provide more informative error messages to help users self-diagnose issues. Enhance troubleshooting documentation with step-by-step guides for common launch problems.

**Monitor platform and version-specific issues:** Track issue trends across different operating systems and PiecesOS versions to identify potential patterns and prioritize fixes for widespread problems.

**Consider a dedicated channel for reporting PiecesOS issues:** Given the volume of PiecesOS-related tickets, create a dedicated channel or form for users to report these issues, streamlining the support process.

**Gather user feedback on recent updates:** Collect feedback from users who experienced launch issues after recent updates to understand the impact of changes and identify areas for improvement in future releases.

**Proactively communicate known issues and workarounds:** Maintain a public-facing list of known issues and workarounds to keep users informed and minimize support requests for already identified problems.

**Invest in automated testing to catch compatibility issues:** Implement rigorous automated testing to identify potential compatibility issues with different hardware and software configurations before releasing updates.

**Analyze support ticket data regularly to identify trends and areas for improvement:** Establish a process for regularly analyzing support ticket data to identify recurring issues, emerging trends, and opportunities for proactive support and product improvements.
